alert.note: Alert for Grand Valley; Roan and Tavaputs Plateaus (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 11 at 5:13PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Garfield, southeastern Uintah and northeastern Grand Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 513 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 28 miles northwest of Fruita, or 37 miles northwest of Grand Junction, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation and outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Garfield, southeastern Uintah and northeastern Grand Counties. This includes Colorado 139 between mile markers 14 and 17, and between mile markers 25 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Grand Valley; Roan and Tavaputs Plateaus
